segment.tokens: The little blue-tit has just fled across our path
The little blue-tit is a very pretty active common everywhere in lanes , woods , and gardens
The blue-tit makes its nest in a wall or a hole in a tree
The blue-tit lays about nine or ten pretty little spotted eggs
How often I remember
when I was a
to have been bitten rather sharply this little bird
whose nest I had placed my hand
I can fancy
I hear the snake-like hissing
the snake-like hissing the blue-tit utters
when some rude hand invades its home
Its food consists of various kinds of insects and insect larvæ , which it finds on the bark of trees and in fruit buds
various kinds of insects and insect larvæ it finds on the bark of trees in fruit buds
I think it much good destroying numbers of injurious insects
does
though gardeners others destroy this bird
because they say
it harms the fruit buds
Look at that little sprightly fellow , how restless he is ; in what curious attitudes he puts himself on yonder branch
how restless he is
at that little sprightly fellow , how restless he is ; in what curious attitudes he puts himself on yonder branch
you hear him tapping quite distinctly
Besides insects blue-tit does not object to make a meal of dead mice or rats
Mr. St. John tells us
that a blue-tomtit once took up his abode in the drawing-room
having been first attracted there the house flies
the house flies crawl on the window
" These he was most searching for catching inserting his little bill into every corner and crevice detecting every fly "
every fly had escaped the brush of the housemaid
He soon became more bold
He came down to pick up crumbs
crumbs the children placed for him on the table
looking up into Mr. St. John 's face without the least apparent fear
Boys sometimes call the little blue-tit Billy Biter no doubt from personal experience of the sharpness of Mr. Tit 's beak
The great tit we can see under the yew tree in our garden almost any hour of the day
The great tit almost any hour of the day is very in the neighbourhood
I dare say
if we look well about us during our walk we shall see some to-day
we shall see some to-day

papa " exclaimed Willy " there are some birds on the towing-path of the canal about sixty yards off "
they seem to be breaking something with their beaks knocking it against the ground ; just look
just look

I can tell you
what they are doing
what we shall find
when we come
up to the spot
We shall see several broken snail shells ( _ Helix _ )
several broken snail shells ( _ Helix _ ) the thrushes find on the grassy slopes of the canal bank

as I told you
you see at least a dozen broken snail shells

Lads in the village , and great grown men from the collieries , are continually hunting for the nests , eggs , or young of thrushes , and many other useful birds , which they wantonly destroy
many other useful birds they wantonly destroy
Now we get on the Duke 's Drive
there on a branch of a poplar tree I see the great tit

see

Major Tit is a of a tyrant sometimes
Major Tit uses that sharp short straight bill of his with deadly effect upon some of his feathered companions , on whose heads he beats repeated blows till he cracks the skulls and eats the brains
upon some of his feathered companions , on whose heads he beats repeated blows till he cracks the skulls and eats the brains

he eats the brains
The marsh-tit the cole-tit are pretty in this neighbourhood
we may often notice them in our walks

Willy dip it amongst the weeds of the pool

he bring to me

a Greek word means " fond of diving "
